comp1406a2

Class Temperature

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp1406a2.Temperature

  • public class Temperature
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to represent temperature (with a value and scale). COMP 1406 Winter 2019 Assignment 2

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Temperature(double temp)
      Initializes a temperature object with given value in Celsius
      Temperature(double temp, Scale scale)
      Initializes a temperature object with given value using the specified scale
      Temperature(Temperature temp)
      Initializes a new temperature object that is a copy of the temperature object parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Temperature

        public Temperature(double temp)
        Initializes a temperature object with given value in Celsius

        If the initial temperature is less than -273.15C then the temperature object will be initialized with -273.15C.

        Parameters:
        temp - is the initial temperature in Celsius.

      • Temperature

        public Temperature(double temp,
                   Scale scale)
        Initializes a temperature object with given value using the specified scale

        If the temperature is lower than absolute zero, in the given scale, then set the temperature to absolute zero (in that scale).

        Usage: new Temperature(12.3, Scale.KELVIN)

        Parameters:
        temp - is the initial temperature in the scale provided in the second argument.
        scale - is the scale of initial temperature and must be a constant defined in the Scale enum type.

      • Temperature

        public Temperature(Temperature temp)
        Initializes a new temperature object that is a copy of the temperature object parameter. That is, it makes a new object that is a copy of the input object.
        Parameters:
        temp - is a non-null temperature object

    • Method Detail

      • getScale

        public char getScale()
        getter for the scale

        The output of this getter method must always be the first letter of one of the names in the Scales enum class. It must be the upper case letter.

        Example: t = new Temperature(12.3, Scale.KELVIN); t.getScale() will then output 'K'

        Returns:
        the first letter (in upper case) of the string representation of the current scale of this object.

      • getTemp

        public double getTemp()
        getter for the temperature
        Returns:
        the temperature of the object using the current scale

      • setScale

        public Temperature setScale(Scale scale)
        setter for scale
        Parameters:
        scale - is the new scale of the temperature and must be a constant from the Scale enum type. The next time you call getTemp(), the temperature will be output in this scale.
        Returns:
        a reference to this object.

      • setTemp

        public Temperature setTemp(double temp)
        setter for temperature
        Parameters:
        temp - is the new temperature (in the object's current scale)
        Returns:
        a reference to this object.

      • setTemp

        public Temperature setTemp(double temp,
                           Scale scale)
        setter for temperature
        Parameters:
        temp - is the new temperature
        scale - is the scale of the new temperature. It must be a constant from the Scale enum type.
        Returns:
        a reference to this object.

      • setTemp

        public Temperature setTemp(double temp,
                           java.lang.String scale)
        setter for temperature
        Parameters:
        temp - is the new temperature.
        scale - is a string representing one of the three scales.
        Returns:
        a reference to this object.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String representation of a temperature object
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
